title: Supporters of San Francisco School-Board Recall Declare Victory
sub_head: Early results show about 75% of voters supported removal of board members in campaign driven by anger over long school closure and focus on social-justice issues
body:
Organizers of a campaign to recall three members of the San Francisco school board are declaring victory after preliminary results showed them with a commanding lead.
As of 9:45 p.m. Pacific time Tuesday, 75% of votes counted were for a recall of board President Gabriela LÃ³pez, 79% for recalling commissioner Alison Collins and 72% for recalling commissioner Faauuga Moliga, according to the city elections department. About 128,000 ballots were tabulated from just under 500,000 registered voters citywide.
